climbs.name: Unknown Left of Rip Off Ranger

content.description:
This route takes a line about 12' left of Rip Off Ranger, just right of the notch.  It is the third bolted line from the right.

Climb past 3 bolts to the anchor and lower off.  Easier than Rip Off Ranger, with a move of 5.8 near the top.

The anchor on this route can also be used to lower off Rip Off Ranger by traversing left after the third bolt on that route.
The third line of bolts from the left takes you up this  fun route. Some good foot work can get you up this thin  route. Really a good climb, just hard to set up as a TR.
content.protection: 4 bolts to some poorly placed anchors. If you  set it up as a TR you will have to place a  directional from either seithing bitch or the last  bolt. Use Short take as the main anchors.

content.description: The last route on the right goes up a small roof ,  avoiding the bat shit.  It used to share anchors at the  top with Rip off Ranger, but someone put another anchor in.
content.protection: 3 QDs and some long slings for the top.

content.description: The third line of bolts from the left. Good anchors at the  top and positive hols all the way up.
content.protection: 3 QDs and something for the anchors at the  top. Two slings will do for TRs.

content.description: Right of center there is a small roof that is climbed by  following three bolts up and over it. The climb is  basically 5.6 until the roof then 8 feet of hard climbing.  Fun. The last 4 feet to the anchors is the crux.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a two bolt anchor. Long slings are need to avoid drag on TR.

content.description: Two bolt anchors at the top directly left of the "notch" mark this route. It is an easy, little climb.

This route is the second to last on the left by the large boulder.  Stay to the left of the bolt line. The hardest moves are definitely just going over the hump to get the anchors.  Really positive hand holds on some sharp rock.
content.protection: You need 3 QDs and something for the  anchors at the top. If you are going to TR it you  should use two longer slings.

content.description: The second route from the right follows 3 bolts up. It is a very fun route with some cool moves and oddly placed bolts. The crux is between the first and second bolts.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 3 bolt anchor at the top. 4' slings  for the top.

content.description: Smack dab in the middle sits this route - right behind the small pine tree. Follow the bolts up and try to stay off the big ledge to the right.  There is a shelf right below the first bolt that marks the  start.
content.protection: 3 bolts and two at the top. Mid [length] slings are needed to avoid rope drag for TR

content.description:
It is in the center of the wall just to the left of the small pine tree. Follow 3 bolts to the top.   Balance and footwork help.

After a couple easy moves, do some hard powerful sidepull/crimps to a jug.  Easier moves to the right after then, or keep at the harder grade by going straight up.
content.protection: 3 QDs then use the anchors for Five Finger  Discount to lower. Or use those and the last  bolt as a directional for TRs.

climbs.name: The 3 Bs
climbs.fa: Bill Morris, Anita Shore, Deanne Yartz, 2003

content.description: "The 3 Bs" is the leftmost line on Punk Rock as you face the rock. It starts up an overhang almost right off the ground, and heads left up the arete after pulling the overhang. The route has two bolts with two fixe ring anchors at the top.
content.protection: 2 QDs plus slings for the anchors.
